headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Intel, FedEx, Meta, Darden Restaurants
summary: ↗️Intel (INTC): The world's most valuable company, Nvidia (NVDA), said it would invest $5 billion in the chip maker. Intel shares soared, closing up 23% on Thursday. Nvidia shares rose 3.5%. ↗️ Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG): The technology giant is teaming up with PayPal (PYPL) on online shopping, planning to combine PayPal's payment infrastructure with its artificial-intelligence expertise.

headline: Olive Garden parent company still a Buy despite Q1 miss: Analyst
summary: Shares of Darden (DRI), Olive Garden's parent company, are sinking after the company reported first quarter earnings results that missed Wall Street's estimates. Guggenheim Securities senior analyst Gregory Francfort joins Market Catalysts with Julie Hyman to discuss the earnings print and explain why he still sees the stock as a Buy. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Olive Garden parent company still a Buy despite Q1 miss: Analyst
content.description:
Shares of Darden (DRI), Olive Garden's parent company, are sinking after the company reported first quarter earnings results that missed Wall Street's estimates.

Guggenheim Securities senior analyst Gregory Francfort joins Market Catalysts with Julie Hyman to discuss the earnings print and explain why he still sees the stock as a Buy.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Olive Garden Parent's Stock Tanks After Quarterly Miss Even As Outlook Remains Strong
summary: Darden Restaurants, Inc. (NYSE:DRI) shares tumbled nearly 10% Thursday after the Olive Garden parent posted weaker-than-expected quarterly earnings and revenue, overshadowing double-digit sales growth fueled by acquisitions and steady same-restaurant gains. The company reported first-quarter adjusted earnings per share of $1.97, missing the analyst consensus estimate of $2.00. Quarterly sales of $3.004 billion missed the Street view of $3.040 billion. Also Read: Darden Restaurants, Factset Resea

headline: Olive Garden parent Darden misses quarterly profit estimates as costs rise
summary: Olive Garden parent Darden Restaurants missed first-quarter profit estimates on Thursday, hurt by higher input and marketing costs amid rising economic uncertainty. The company raised its annual sales growth forecast to 7.5% to 8.5%, but the midpoint of the range came in largely below analysts' average estimate of 8.3%, according to data compiled by LSEG. The LongHorn Steakhouse owner's shares, which have gained nearly 12% this year, were down about 8% in premarket trading following the results.

content.title: Olive Garden parent Darden misses quarterly profit estimates as costs rise
content.summary: Olive Garden parent Darden Restaurants missed first-quarter profit estimates on Thursday, hurt by higher input and marketing costs amid rising economic uncertainty. The company raised its annual sales growth forecast to 7.5% to 8.5%, but the midpoint of the range came in largely below analysts' average estimate of 8.3%, according to data compiled by LSEG. The LongHorn Steakhouse owner's shares, which have gained nearly 12% this year, were down about 8% in premarket trading following the results.

headline: Darden’s (NYSE:DRI) Q3 Earnings Results: Revenue In Line With Expectations But Stock Drops
summary: Restaurant company Darden (NYSE:DRI) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 10.4% year on year to $3.04 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.97 per share was 2% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: How Does Darden Stack Up After Its 35% Jump and Recent Acquisition of Ruth’s Chris?
summary: Deciding whether to buy, sell, or hold Darden Restaurants can feel a bit like scanning a menu with too many good options. The stock’s recent moves only make the decision more interesting. Even though Darden slipped by 1.3% over the last week, it edged up 1.6% in the past month, and its track record over the past year is nothing short of impressive, up 35.3%. Looking at a longer timeframe, the growth story stands out, with gains of 75.7% over three years and a striking 170.3% over five...
